attributes.comment:
I am writing in opposition to the proposed fee increses as they pertain to adoption-
related petitions. Currently, the processing time for an international adoption is
longer than the life of the I-171H form. My husband and I completed our I-600A in
December 2005 and, not having even finalized the adoption we were approved for,
are having to redo the same paperwork as it will expire before our first child is
placed with us.

Looking at the proposal posted on-line, the government is not planning on seeing
an increase in workload volume on either the I-600 or I-600A. Such adoption-
related petitions are also taking a limited amount of processing time compared to
other applications the USCIS deals with. Most applicants (adoptive families) have
already been through 3-4 months of detailed paperwork/screening before filing with
the USCIS and their applications will be easy to process as they've been guided
by their respective agencies on the proper way to submit such forms.

The proposed increase in adoption-related fees by 66% unfairly targets families
who are already bearing an expensive burnden and, most likely, are interested in
pursuing more than one adoption to complete their families. Such drastic changes
in fees is likely to discourage those who have already taken a financial hit to
complete one adoption.

Please reconsider the increase, or amount of increase, in adoption-related
petitions in an effort to support those families who are willing to provide a safe,
nuturing, and loving home to some of the world's abandoned children. Thank you.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kelly Hagele
